result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan J. Bessert was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 347.413(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jordan J. Bessert in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 14CM227, 15CM22, 13CM248, 14CM251, 13CM225 @ 3:14 p.m. Agreement stated - 14CM227 plead to charge, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, counseling, court costs. 14CM251 plead to cts 1 & 2, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, counseling, court costs, AODA and follow through. Ct 3 dismiss. 15CM22 plead to cts 2, 3, & 4. Ct2 - $150 plus costs, ct 3 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, counseling, AODA and follow through, ct 4 - 45 days jail w/credit for good time, costs, 60 days to commence. Cts 1, 5, & 6 dismiss and read in. 13CM248, 13CM225 - dismissed and read in. Atty Debord agrees. Off record briefly. Back on the record. Def agrees with agreement as stated. Plea quest. reviewed.  14CM227 ct 1 -no contest plea. 14CM251 ct 1 - no contest plea, ct 2 - no contest. 15CM22 ct 2 - no contest plea, ct 3 - no contest plea, ct 4 - no contest plea. 15CM22 cts 1, 5, & 6 dismissed and read in. 13CM248 and 13CM225 dismissed and read in. 14CM251 ct 3 dismissed. Constitutional rights reviewed. Off the record briefly. Elements and possible penalties reviewed. Atty Debord satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis stipulated. Court finds factual basis. 14CM227 finds guilty of ct 1. 15CM22 Court finds guilty of cts 2, 3 & 4. 14CM251 Court finds guilty of cts 1 & 2. Counsel heard on sentencing. Statement by Defendant. Remarks by the Court, will depart from plea agreement, states reasons. 15CM22 ct 2 - $150 plus costs, no DNA surcharge. Ct 3 - withheld jail sentence, 2 yrs probation, counseling as required, AODA and follow through, costs. ct 4 - 2 yrs probation, concurrent, 7 days jail, report in 60 days, court costs. Report no later than 11/9/15 @ 6p.m. Huber. 
14CM251 ct 1 withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, concurrent, counseling, AODA and follow through, court costs. ct 2 - same as ct 1, concurrent.
14CM227 - withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, counseling, court costs. Apply bond in 14CM251 to ct 2 in 15CM22 first and balance applied to other costs.
  If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Postconviction rights.

Defendant Jordan J. Bessert in court with attorney Brent Harold Debord.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 13CM248, 13CM225, 14CM227, 14CM251, 15CM22, 14TR1184, 14TR1185, and 14TR1199 @ 1:40 p.m. Agreement stated - 13CM225 in exchange for other pleas, State moves to dismiss. 13CM248 - in exchange for pleas in other cases, State moves to dismiss. Has complied with victim rights. 14CM251 plea to cts 1 & 2, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, counseling, court costs. Ct 3 dismiss.  14CM227 Def will plead to charge, withheld sentence, 1 yr pr, AODA, counseling, court costs. 15CM22 - plead to cts 2, 3, 4, dismiss cts 1, 5, & 6. Ct 2 - $150 plus costs. Ct 3 withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, counseling, costs. Ct 4 - State will argue for 90 days jail, court costs. Atty Debord agrees. Court reviews plea quest. 14CM251 ct 1 - no contest plea. ct 2 - no contest plea. Ct 3 dismissed. 15CM22 ct 2  - Def has questions. Discussion regarding D.L.  Def wishes to postpone to try to get driver's license.  Statement by Atty Debord. Off the record. Back on the record. Court asks Def if he wishes to proceed. Def wants to adjourn. Statement by Atty Debord. Court will allow to adjourn.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
Probable Cause Statement and Judicial Determination
